Job Title: Asbestos Inspector

Location: Little Rock Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Engineering, Science

Description:
Our Snyder Environmental Business Unit is seeking an organized self-starter with a high attention to detail to help us grow our environmental inspections business line. The ideal candidate will have superior time management skills love the road warrior lifestyle as this position requires constant travel around the state. 
Don't miss out on this very interesting role that will take you all over our beautiful state so that you can improve our communities!
Position Description â€“ Asbestos Inspector
Business Group/Dept: OperationsFLSA: ExemptReports To: Branch Manager Date: February 13, 2024
Purpose of the Position
Performs inspections for asbestos, lead-based paint (commercial), and/or mold (including air sampling) in compliance with federal and state requirements. Obtains samples of suspect asbestos containing materials, lead-based paint, or mold affected materials from sites and submits them to laboratory for analysis. Essential Position Responsibilities
technical information and original work to customers and other interested parties.schedule, and perform inspections on sites that may be abandoned/derelict, under construction, or occupied.customer/client questions regarding inspection process or ACM, LBP, and mold.movement from inspection to abatement/remediation process proposal.a positive company representative in all internal and external communications.
Physical activities: Enters and locates information on a smartphone, tablet, or computer, often in small print. Communicates with customers, employees, and home office staff in person, over the phone, or via email (sometimes after hours). Must be on feet for up to 10 hours per day; regular standing, sitting, kneeling, twisting, and carrying of up to 15 to 50 pounds; must be able to work in adverse site conditions; extreme hot/cold, wet/dry environment.
Personal Protective Equipment (PPE): Half-face respirator; full-face respirator; steel toed footwear; hard hat; safety vest; protective eyewear; gloves; Tyvek suit
Safety Sensitive: Yes
Travel: 25% to 100%
Minimum Education: High School Diploma or GED; Applicable licenses for assigned territory necessary to handle and inspect hazardous materials such as: asbestos; lead; mold; etc.
Preferred Skill set: Experience in Construction or Environmental Remediation

Experience Level (if available): Associate
